Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: C0nstant_vacati0ner
Reviews.Content: Great budget B & B located one block from the forum, Piazza Venezia and the Colosseum. Clean rooms, friendal and helpful staff. Nothing snazzy, but great for anyone looking for a decent, clean place to sleep that is centrally oloacted for Ancient Rome. Would recommend it for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: TaniaExeter
Reviews.Content: I booked this on tripadvisor recommendations and cannot rate it highly enough. I stayed with a friend and my 7 year old daughter. The hotel is through a courtyard off a main road so in the centre of old Rome, but quiet. It is spotless; cleaned daily, and fresh towels daily. it is 5 minutes walk from the Cavour metro (1 stop down from Termini) and 5 minutes to the colisseum. Food recommendations from the reception staff were spot on! Breakfast at the patisserie just up from the hotel was delicious; and lunch at another place about 3 shops up was fabulous! We all thought the hotel was perfect- not expensive for our short break- and would thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: deb2522
Reviews.Content: My daughter stayed here twice while travelling in and out of Rome for University this past summer. The room was nice, well located and extremely clean. I had met the owners on a previous visit and they were very friendly and more then willing to accommodate your requests and needs. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, welcoming family and very clean. Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: riki71
Reviews.Content: My son (17yrs) and I stayed here for 7 days while we were in Rome. The hotel was centrally located near everything we wanted to see. Very safe neighborhood and we could walk almost everywhere. The metro station is just a few blacks away so if we were tired at the end of the day we could take that back to the hotel and then plan for the next day. While breakfast was not included there were plenty of places to get a quick bite or pastry. There is a grocery store just up the street so we were able to get our travel snacks for the day and off we went. Francesca and family were very accomidating and I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, Room nice and big”
Reviews.Author: Jchernan562
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 days in mid June. i'll write first the good points and second the points that for some travelers might be cons. For me, they weren't deal breakers. Good points: Location - Perfect location to walk to some places. Colosseum is just about 2 blocks going one way and to the other side about a few blocks Vittorio Emanuelle monument. The metro is close either the colosseum or Cavour which is about a 5 min walk. There are also a few eating places. ROOM - Our room was big as well as the bathroom. Room was clean every day and we got new towels without asking. We also had a nice balcony view. Reception is 24 hours and they have beverages for sale (water, juices, soda etc) and cheap. Bottle of water only .50 euro. This was great coming back late at night or heading out in the hot weather in the morning. PRICE - For the location, I found the price to be reasonable. Now here are the points that might be cons for other travelers: Breakfast- There is no breakfast Reception: They don't speak much english, so depends who's in the desk. But I did get answers to my questions. Noise - Some of the days, the maid started cleaning rooms very early, so we heard the vaccuum before 9am. Not sure why they would start cleaning that early. Also, a couple of days we heard the Bells ringing from a church which rang 6 or 7 am. So if you like to have a great sleep, the bells might wake you up or the maid. But maybe if you as the reception not to turn the vacuum that early they might accomodate your request. Overall, it was a great stay and I wouldn't mind staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Bargin and Service with a Smile”
Reviews.Author: K-Davis2011
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great base to explore the Eternal City and all its beauty, this is the place for you. Less than 5 minute, slow walk to the Colosseum, Forum, Victorio Emmanuel Momumnet. If you need to catch a Metro, it is located about two blocks away. The room and the pension were very clean, bright and practical. Bathrooms and showers were very clean. I found the rooms to be above average in size compared to other European hotels/pensions. The inner courtyard and the pension staff, which is family owned, makes you feel as if you are staying with Italian friends. The inner courtyard, away from the bustle of the city, provided a serene refuge from the noise and enabled us to rest peacefully. There is no breakfast provided, but the continental breakfast provided at other hotels is poor, in my opinion. We had to extend our stay for a day, but Francesca with her always bright smile was able to change a few things and accommodate us for that extra night. We did have to change rooms for two out of the five nights to make this accommodation, but they moved us while we were sightseeing so as to not incovenience us. Typically, you would have to move yourself at any other hotel or pension. Francesca, her brother and mother were very helpful with suggestions and directions. This is truly a gem in the most beautiful city in the world. Highly recommended this place as someone who has traveled extensively for both business and travel.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: TimBob74
Reviews.Content: We chose Rome as the final stop of our three week Italian holiday. Here we will spend three days and nights soaking up the last bits of Italy that our souls can hold. Our choice was to stay near Ancient Rome at Hotel Rosetta. This was a good move on our part! This safe, clean, and secure hotel is located a short 20 minute walk from the Colosseum and Forum area. The Rome Termini station is a 30 minute walk. Here you board the bus for Galleria Borghese. Rick Steves' "Night Walk Across Rome" originates at Campo de' Fiori, another reasonable walk to that spot. We entered the hotel property from the busy street, walked through an enclosed courtyard and up a few steps to the lobby of the hotel. Francesca warmly welcomed us and quickly checked us in. She also reminded us of our appointment to visit the Galleria Borghese the next day. You must have a reservation for this site and Francesca took care of the arrangements in advance. The room itself was simple and clean. The bathroom was also perfectly clean. This hotel is more than adequate and met our needs. The main attraction to this hotel is the location. At this point in our trip, we were happy to not have to use much public transportation to get around. Here you are able to get to most of the important sites by walking. Francesca and her brother are very good hosts. They are helpful and they smile and laugh with you as they show you the Rome map hoping that you don't get too lost. We enjoyed our three days in Rome very much. Francesca at Hotel Rosetta went out of her way to make our stay even more enjoyable. Tim and Susan - Arizona

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Rosetta!”
Reviews.Author: clm1113
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rosetta was a great little hotel to stay at if you're ok with a simple, no frills place. We paid just 120 euros a night for a quadruple room. It's only a 5ish minute walk from the Colosseum and Forum. If you don't mind walking, it is possible to walk all over Rome from the hotel...to the Vatican, the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain, etc. If you'd rather take the metro, the hotel is right in between the Colosseo and Cavour stops, a 5 minute walk to either one. Francesca and her family were very helpful in answering our questions and giving us recommendations. She and her sister and brother all speak English. Her mother does not, but she's very nice as well and we were still able to chat even with my limited Italian! There is free wifi available in the lobby. The room that we stayed in wasn't very large but it was still comfortable and clean. The bathroom was a good size and we had a cute little balcony as well. The hot water did run out a couple times but we fixed that by just showering at different times. Looking at the hotel, to the left of it is a small food/sandwich/liquor shop which is a good place to pick up snacks and water (only 55 euro cents) for the day. And I do also offer a word of caution about the cafe across the street. I believe it was 17 euros for my parents to sit down and have a coffee, cannoli, and tiramisu there. However there is a pretty good restaurant across the street and tucked away a bit called Ristorante Cleto. If I return to Rome I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “I'll never go anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: poocherTampa
Reviews.Content: With the excellent online reviews, our expectations were high for our 5 day stay in Rome, but they were exceeded. The room was in the new section, all was ready for us, clean and tidy, even though we checked in early. The location is just so wonderful. If you walk up or down Cavour street, you can see the Colesseum. 5 minutes to the forum. We enjoyed the restaurant "Wanted" a few steps down one street, the two Chinese restaurants nearby, and the Kebab place just beyond "Wanted." The bakery/deli next door had a wide choice and the grocery across from the Cavour train station was convenient. Yes, this was our 6th week in Italy and we had consumed too much pasta. But I'd really like to talk about how wonderful and helpful Fransceca and her family were. Our flights back to the US got royally screwed up by the travel agency, and though it wasn't her problem, Fransceca took her time on two days to be sure that we could fly out on time and without hassles. I can't imagine any mega-hotel being so helpful, and frankly, I would be surprised if most B&B's or pensions would help so much. This was on top of providing a well-priced, well-located room. That's why I will never go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great price & squeaky clean!”
Reviews.Author: lmsbw70
Reviews.Content: The price was great and the room was extremely clean. It's just a basic, simple room. You won't find anything fancy here. If that's not an issue for you, this is the place to stay. The staff is very friendly and helpful. BEWARE of the cafe across the road. They charged us an ungodly amount for gelato and coffee!

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in location and service in all of Italy!”
Reviews.Author: 60763Love2Travel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled Italy last summer for a month and Hotel Rosetta was our favorite hotel. The family-owned hotel provides kind and giving service! The son and daughter were extremely helpful - they helped us with making reservations at museums and directions. The hotel's location is just down the street from the Colosseum! It's really in center of it all! You do have to make sure to keep your eye out for the address though. It's a large door just off the street, but when u walk in, it's so cute with a little outdoor patio. Stay here! I would go back again! Rome is the most romantic city I've ever been to!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Rosetta - a great price in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Lacerda_2
Reviews.Content: We have stayed for 4 nights (from October 28th to Noember 1st) in a superior room in this hotel. Service was very good and people were really fine. Our room was very clean with a comfortable bed. The bathroom was new and big, but there was a little bad smelling probably coming from the plumbing. Not a problem at all. Location was good, very near the Colosseum and Fori Imperiali. The price was very good: 105 euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family run hotel in the heart of ancient Rome.”
Reviews.Author: mannwill
Reviews.Content: This is a small family run business. The rooms are very well appointed, spotlessly clean with individual heat and air conditioning controls. The family try excel in looking after their guests. It is about a 10-15 minute walk to the Coliseum.

Reviews.Title: “Close to "Ancient Rome"”
Reviews.Author: prossima2
Reviews.Content: When our cab driver let us off at the huge ancient wooden door right on the sidewalk of Via Cavour, I thought there had been a mistake because it didn't look like a "hotel." The door was locked but a buzzer to the left read Hotel Rosetta and when pushed, someone buzzed us in and the door opened. We walked into a quiet courtyard and found the stairs to the hotel straight across from the entrance. A young man, part of the family who run the hotel, cheerfully carried our bags up and showed us our room. It was tiny, but clean and quiet. The usual double, of two twins pushed together. We were there to sightsee, not to hang out in a luxury hotel, so the size didn't matter. The price, $90 Euro was reasonable for such a good location in Rome. We were on Via Cavour just a short walk from the intersection with Dei Fora Imperiale. At the intersection, the Colosseum was just down on the left, the Forum and the Pallatine Hill almost straight across the street. There was a superb restaurant on the tiny, ancient, Via Della Madonna del Monte, just behind the hotel, called Taverna Dei Fori Imperiali. We also found a wonderful place to get our morning cappuccino....turn right as you go out the door onto Via Cavour and it's the only coffee bar before reaching Dei Fora Imperiale. It had a sign sticking out over the door that said 'BAR.' It was friendly and had a terrific cappucino for one Euro. A few doors to the left from the hotel was a great gelateria: the Conesseo, best I tried in Rome. Whatever you do, don't try the pizzaria across the street, very bad pizza with a dry, hard, cardboard flavor crust. If, like us, you sometimes want supper before 7:30...there is a Chinese restaurant also a few doors to the left on Via Cavour that has a great hot and sour soup and opens at six. All in all, we were very satisfied with our hotel choice and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Rosetta - best location and service in a budget friendly hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: MiishaMeemers
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rosetta is in the perfect location - practically a stone's throw away from the Colosseum, Forum & Palatine Hill and a short walk from Termini Station. It is on a main road (Via Cavour) but rooms overlook a small courtyard and are actually quiet and private. The room was a decent size - very basic, but VERY clean. The bathroom was aged, but spotless - the floors sparkled. We stayed 3 nights and the room was cleaned every night with fresh towels (the cleaner actually folded and put my pj's under my pillow!). The hotel is very secure and the service we received from the young man at the main desk (hotel is family run) was outstanding. His English was fantastic and he really went above and beyond to ensure our stay in Rome was enjoyable. This hotel is by no means a 5-star hotel, but the service and quality of the room certainly made it felt like a 5-star! Thank you for a wonderful stay in Rome - we will return and most definitely stay at Hotel Rosetta again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...clean accommodations, friendly staff, well-priced, strategically located!”
Reviews.Author: Yester
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Rosetta for 3 nights at the very start of our two week trip to Italy. Nestled inside a building that you enter through a private court, Rosetta was our refuge from the chaos of the city after a long day walking and touring through the crowded streets of Rome. The small but dedicated staff made great recommendations for restaurants nearby, best bus routes to sites, and just about anything else we inquired about. They even went out of their way to help ensure my wife's ice pack was cold every morning and evening by placing it in their fridge for us. If I could nit-pick, the only somewhat negative I'd say is that the beds were not the most comfortable in the world (a little too firm for my taste, anyway), though that seemed to be the case just about wherever we stayed in Italy. If you are looking for a simple, cozy, stress-free stay in Rome, I highly recommend Rosetta. We will definitely stay there again on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Best value and location in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: paradiseroaming
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Rosetta was the best place we stayed in Italy. Keeping on a budget can be tough, especially in Rome. The Hotel Rosetta is located in the heart of Rome. It is also one of the quietest places we stayed. It is close to the Metro subway and only one stop from the central train station. We walked to the Colisseum, Roman Forum, all the main fountains, and even to the Spanish steps. The shops next door are great for wine and snacks. Make sure to get some fresh green olives (not brined). The shop had them sitting on top of the cheese/olive counter in a large bowl of olive oil. There was a great bakery nearby; try the Sfogliatelle pastries. (They look like clams filled with creamy, sweet, ricotta and sprinkled with powdered sugar.) Everywhere we stayed in Italy had stairs. Although we never used it, the Hotel Rosetta was the only place we saw with an elevator. The staff was awesome! They spoke English very well and gave us suggestions where to eat, what to see, and how to get there. When I got sick, they even sent up a pot of citric tea and a plate of cookies.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Stay”
Reviews.Author: Yes27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice in 2 seperate rooms. 85-90 euro beginning of september for private bathroom and 2 people; no breakfast. Pros: 1. The building inside is very cozy. I felt very safe. 2. The area is great, there is a bar right across. 5min walk from Colosseum. 3. Absolutely no bugs or mosquittos outside, so we could open our windows. 4. Very nice hosts. Cons: 1. Those who have trouble sleeping may find it noisey. You either hear noise outside depending on which side you face, or you hear noise through the walls. We are tight sleepers so the noise did not wake us up. 2. The first place we stayed at, the showers were horrible! so tiny that it was the most uncomfortable shower ever. They say if the hot water runs out to wait 20 min. There is usually enough water for it not to run out. However, one of the 3 nights we stayed there, we woke up and there was no hot water; we waiting 40min and still no hot water. However, the second room we stayed at, we had no trouble with the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Wasatch01
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Rosetta is a hotel near the colosseum and metro blue line. We had the quad room to sleep my wife and I and our two teenagers. The room was very basic - a few paintings on the wall may have dressed it up a little. The bathroom was small but functional. The room was cleaned without fail with clean towels each day. Walking distance to many sites Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Colosseum, Pantheon, etc but we are accustomed to walking. Have good walking shoes and in the summer, carry water bottles. No breakfast or internet was available. The true highlight to the Rosetta in our opinion was Francesca and her family at the front desk. Without fail, they were very helpful and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Basic room with a good location”
Reviews.Author: excitedtraveller23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for three nights. The rooms are very basic, but I suppose that is why it's cheaper than most hotels in Rome. The room had fluorescent lighting, which made us feel as if we were in a hospital room. The shower was not separated by a tub, so even though there was a curtain it still didn't stop the water from going all over the bathroom floor. The room got hot at night, so we had to open the windows. However, by doing that it made the room very noisy from all the cars and people on the streets. We slept with earplugs each night. There was a little television in the room, but it was broken. Other than the price, this hotel is great for location. It is a few blocks away from a metro stop and the Colosseum. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is just looking for a cheap place to sleep, but if you are looking for a quiet, charming room, this isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brnp
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the hotel with our 1 year old daughter. The hotel is conveniently located near Colosseum and well connected to Termini. There is a bus stop right outside the hotel and you can walk to Metro stop in 2 minutes. We found taking the bus to Termini and from there to other tourist attractions very convenient. The street is busy with lot of convenience stores and restaurants. If you like Indian food, then check out Sitar, which is across the street. Best of all, the hotel staff are very good. The gentleman at the desk who did not speak a lot of English was very helpful with our day to day needs. The room was decent in size; in great condition and very convenient. We strongly recommend Hotel Rosetta if you are considering a trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: BluegrassTarheel
Reviews.Content: This is a family run hotel that's in a very good location near the Ancient Roman sites. They don't serve breakfast, but you can get it just up the street. The nearby gelateria is the best we found in our travels and we had an exceptional meal just around the corner. The rooms are basic and small, but the bathroom was newly renovated. The bed was very firm and the room, very quiet. Cheap drinks are available in the lobby. Front desk is manned overnight. This is a really good deal.

Reviews.Title: “The best option to stay in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: bccosta21
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days in this lovely place, and the best are the location and treatment we received from the staff... The owners are very polity and try to help you in anything they can. It was easy to find, 3 minutes from the subway. The room was very clean, and despite the fact there is no luxury, it was exactly what we have expected. For sure we will come back in the future... The Coliseum is very near the hotel, and Francesca gave to us all support we need. The street is not beautiful, but is acceptable. It is a cheap place, where a couple can stay and enjoy the city, without to spend too much.. Thank you, Rosetta!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jill32
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rosetta seems to have been recently renovated. It is very clean and new looking. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Located a 10 min walk from the Colosseum. There is no view (it's in to an alley way). I would definitely recommend this hotel for a young couple on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel near everything in Ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: cptdickey
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel with great location and a fabulous staff. Francesca and the other staff helped us with everything from nearest the laundry mat to printing out boarding passes. The hotel is less than 5 minutes from the Coloseum, Palatine Hill and the Forum. There is a subway stop about 3 minutes away. Lot's of great restaraunts in the neighborhood. The hotel has been remodeled very recently and has very clean rooms with updated bathrooms. Our room had a flat screen TV with Italian cable, which included the BBC News. Wi-Fi internet is free and the signal is good in the rooms near the lobby. Two drawbacks though. The night time sounds from the back rooms can be heard pretty easily, especially people going back home after a night out. The acoustics inside can be bad because the floors are tile and the walls are plaster with nothing to soak up the sound.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: Cono_B
Reviews.Content: i was stuck in Rome for a few more days due to the volcanic ash and found this hotel at 9pm on a chilly, rainy night. went without a reservation and luckily was taken in and given a room. turned out to be a very nice budget hotel - family-run, basic rooms, with a great location and very good prices. the staff was polite,friendly, and helpful especially the daughter. would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ssteph17
Reviews.Content: At the beginning of September we went on a two day break to Rome and stayed at the Hotel Rosetta. The location of the hotel was perfect within a five minute walk of the Colosseum. Hotel Rosetta was located on a main street (Via Cavour) but was very quiet as the main door to the premises entered into a courtyard. The rooms were very clean, comfortable and we had a good fan in our room which you need during the Summer season! The staff were very pleasant and helpful. Overall quite a basic hotel but excellent value for money and a safe area for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Atenas08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and it was great. If you are planning to visit Rome, you'll only need a place to sleep and shower unless you are planning to use the hotel for more things. If this is your case, this hotel is not your best choice. This one in particular has three good things: Great Location, Good Price and of course it is clean.

Reviews.Title: “Like everybody else said - great value, friendly reception”
Reviews.Author: underwateraq
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for six nights altogether, five night at the beginning of our trip and one night in the end. Our room is on the first floor pretty close to the reception desk. It was old but VERY CLEAN. However the shower stall is ridiculously small. And I mean it. My husband and I are both mid-size Chinese - pretty slim and we had a hard time turning in the shower stall. If you are anywhere more than 140, 150 lbs and more than 5'5, do yourself a favor and ask for a room with bigger shower stall when you book because the one they put you in will not fit. But the location is very good, the owner's son is very very nice. He helped me with luggage and reservations, that was really nice of him. So as long as you ask for a bigger bathroom, this is exceptional value!

Reviews.Title: “Great price. Fabulous location. Awesome staff.”
Reviews.Author: LaChatNoir
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Rosetta. Our room was clean, comfortable, air-conditioning worked great, and the bathroom was downright spacious ... especially considering bathrooms we saw in other hotels in Italy. Once you enter off the busy Via Cavour into the courtyard, it's much quieter. Our room was up a flight of stairs from check-in, and our window faced the alley/street in back. We didn't have any issues with noise at all. Francesca did indicate that we received a superior room, and there were other rooms just off of reception that looked tighter and not as newly renovated. Our bathroom was marble floors and walls, large sink and giant shower. Francesca was amazing. Very helpful and knowledgable with bus routes and restaurant recommendations. We enjoyed Taverna Roma (the restaurant in back that other reviewers have mentioned); Taverna Imperiali, Tavernella, Angelitti's, and Wanted (the only place we ever ate twice ... we went back for the pasta bags!) ... all within walking easy distance. Location was amazing. Wonderful for night walks to major ruins and monuments. Close to metro stops, we had light luggage and it was easy to take train from FCO to Termini and take metro from Termini to Cavour stop. Walk just a few blocks to the hotel. There is a brass plaque that says Hotel Rosetta near the big wooden door to the courtyard, look for the vertical yellow Trattoria sign ... the entrance is near that. Hotel staff keeps your room key whenever you go out, and we never had a problem getting buzzed back in/let in to our room.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better!”
Reviews.Author: Lina_Brasil
Reviews.Content: This is not a bad option for the price, but you can do better. The room was old but clean, no breakfast or internet. The location is good - near Coliseu, Fontana di Trevi, subway. Our problem was the owners - we booked 4 nights, but on the third we decided to leave in the next day. The night before, we told that to the guy in the front desk and he said "ok, no problem". In the morning, when we showed up with our luggage to leave, the owner and her daughter Francesca screamed at us and said we didn´t tell them, a man was shouting from inside saying they should bill us for 4 nights. We said nothing and waited untill they stopped yelling. Finally, they charged us for 3 nights, but not without complainig a lot!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staying”
Reviews.Author: kodon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rosetta hotel in Rome for 2 nights in the end of October. I must say that it was an excellent choice in terms of location, cost, staff and sanitary. First - the location of course. Just a few minutes away from the Roman Forum and the Colleseum. 10 minutes away from Piazza Venezia and you can calculate the rest. There metro station is about 7 minutes away. Second - cost. Really decent for that location in Rome. Third - the staff. Really really helpful (especially the young man which I don't remember his name). Shows all the key places on a tourist map. I really recommend to use their help. Finaly - it is a really clean place. Our room was renovated and looked brand new. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Location & Value for money”
Reviews.Author: AhDave
Reviews.Content: We (Me and my wife) stayed at Hotel Rosetta for 3 nights. Family own/run hotel makes it friendly. Not like a typical commercialized hotel. Via Cavour is located heart of the City. Roman Forum and The Colosseum or Roman Coliseum are virtually located virtually a stone throw away. Rooms are not fantastic, but good enough for people who just want to sleep at night and spend most of the time outdoors. You must try the restaurant just behind the hotel. Reasonable price and good quality food. Overall we like the hotel, would stay there again in our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION IS EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: CAROCAET
Reviews.Content: We were at the Hotel Rosetta for a family wedding - the family owned and run hotel is very basic as the price of €90 per room per night would indicate. Family members were lovely and very helpful - thank you Franchesca. Room was kept very clean - no meals provided or coffee/tea, no safe or hairdryer, but you would know this in advance. My main complaint would be noise - we were in a double room looking out into the alley and the restaurant at the back of the hotel has it's kitchen under the hotel - the noise of traffic and passersby plus dishes being washed until 3 in the morning was awful. You should try for a courtyard facing room, I did, but even though booking in March for September - they were all gone. My biggest like was the extremely helpful family who own/run the hotel and gave us good advice on restaurants etc and the LOCATION - you are so close to all the main attractions - except the Vatican. The station is a good 15 minutes walk straight up the Via Cavour - (has a good steak house if you tire of pasta and at reasonable prices). This is also where the tour bus terminus is. Security was quite good at the hotel, with guests having keys for street door, door into corridor where rooms are. You can leave your valuables at reception where they will be kept in the safe. Overall the Hotel Rosetta is good value because of the LOCATION - the accommodation is very basic and the rooms are small, but clean - bathroom is not modern at all - cistern with a real chain to pull (ours sprayed a fine mist of water on our heads), but was fixed immediately we notified the front desk. Enough hot water and fresh towels each day. Can recommend - because in Rome - you mainly want to see the sights - so you won't be in your room at all.

Reviews.Title: “not more than okay”
Reviews.Author: Sagittarius_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Rosetta two nights in July. We had booked a four bed room, but got a double with two extra beds. No space to move, no daylight through the window due to close housewall, minibathroom where shower and toilet were almost in the same place. Strange plastic covers under sheets, which gave a very uncomfortable feeling during the night. Positive things to say - situated close to Colosseum, the room was clean and the receptionists very helpful. After all this wasn´t a pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE Hotel Rosetta”
Reviews.Author: KNYCK
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rosetta, aside from it's prime location near the Colosseum and right next to the Cavour metro stop, was affordable and the service was wonderful! The four of us arrived ready to settle into our quad, the room wasn't ready so they gave us a better quad than what we had reserved for the same price. We came back a second time during our tour in Italy and again the hotel was a perfect choice for a budget traveler looking for a deal! I booked the rooms through the hotel website which worked perfectly! The rooms are nice - sufficient room for a European hotel, and the bathrooms were clean. Although the showers were very small, it was worth it given the location and price. The only downside might be the noise level, but they have double-pained windows that work pretty well if you decide to sleep with the windows closed. I highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: WazzaTroy
Reviews.Content: I am currently still here 18/6/08 (night 3 of 4 night stay). I am very happy with the room they put me in, 60 euros per night for a single though it has a queen size bed and own toilet and shower. With aircond. If I poke my head out of window i can just see the Colloseum which is bugger all distance to walk from here. It can be quiet noisy at night or that might have just been last night due too Itily winning at the Soccer and qualifing into next round of Eurocup. The hotel staff are very friendly and willing to help out when asked and give best directions to get around. The hotel itself is a little hard to find on Via Cavour as only has a small brass plaque on side of big wooden door. The hotel staff keep the room clean everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Rosetta is a Great Option!”
Reviews.Author: T25
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rosetta is located very close to the Coliseum and other major sights in the middle of Rome all within walking distance and this was why we wanted to stay here. The rooms are very clean, if not small, but really we were more interested in an affordable option that would allow us to have a good night's sleep at a reasonable price. Following a budget was important and Hotel Rosetta came through. All staff were super friendly and very helpful. Our Room was off of an alleyway and near the busy Via Cavour but really, just close the window and turn on the AC and you can't hear anything. For those looking for a great neighbourhood with plenty of restaurant options, a 5 minute walk to the Forum, Coliseum, and other attractions, this place is excellent and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Italy-loverNorway
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Rosetta for 5 nights in May. It was our first stay, but not the last! The room was basic, but nice and spacious - except for the bathroom, but we soon got used to the toilet/shower combination. Before we went, we were afraid the street noise of Via Cavour would keep us awake all night, but from our inside room we could'nt hear it. The staff was very friendly, the room clean and safe. The location is convenient, with several good (and economic) restaurants nearby. We would recommend Hotel Rosetta to those who want a central place to stay without having to pay a fortune. Great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Opinion about Hotel Rosetta”
Reviews.Author: AmericanExpatsUK
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to Rome, and I chose Hotel Rosetta after seeing all of the great reviews online. The hotel is basic... and if you're used to traveling through Europe, it's a typical 2 star hotel. (Interesting shower/toilet combo, no decorations, etc.). However, we travel on a budget, and love these cheap finds with a good location. Here are a few thoughts on our stay (April 2008): 1.) The location is terrific. Just a 3-4 minute walk to the Colleseum, Palantine Hill, etc. Two metro options are within a 5 minute walk (Colleseum and Cavour) and both of these options have a quick metro connection to Rome Termini station (1 Euro) 2.) My main issue with the hotel was the awful noise level from Cavour Road. We stayed in the quadruple room, which overlooked Cavour, which was FILLED with traffic - even at 4AM. Cars honking.... ambulances at all hours, and the scooters speeding by were surprisingly noisy. Most of us were still awake at 4AM, wishing we had ear plugs to drown out the noise. If the window was open, you could hardly hear another person talk across the room. It was awful. My husband is sleeps like a hibernating animal... and it even woke him up! However, all of the other rooms appeared to be either in the courtyard, or on the other side of our noisy room. So, if you are booking the quadruple room (#21), do not stay here. If you are booking any other room, I bet you won't have any of the noise problems. We were just unlucky with the room location & Carvour. (Or ask upon reserving the room to make sure you don't get room 21 - or a room overlooking Cavour.) 3.) The staff was willing to hold our luggage, which was a bonus. They also had a hairdryer available on request. 4.) Pay in cash... we asked before submitting payment on check-out, and they dropped the price by approx. 5%. 5.) There are a few good restaurants and a fantastic Gelato shop in the area (around the back corner). Do not go to the Cafe/Pizza/Gelato shop across from the hotel. VERY unfriendly and very pricey. Walk a minute or two behind the hotel, and you'll find a few great places.

Reviews.Title: “Just Charming!”
Reviews.Author: europatraveller
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! First of all, it is clean and well-kept -- a welcome relief given some of the other places I've stayed! Secondly, moreover, the hotel enjoys a prime location. Not only does it sit within about a five-minutes' walk of the Colosseum, but it also happens to be on a busy street, so I felt comfortable walking home alone in the dark. I was sorry to leave the Hotel Rosetta and would definitely return if I were to visit Rome again!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best location”
Reviews.Author: luluPerth_Australia
Reviews.Content: My family (husband and two teenage sons) first stayed at the Rosetta in August 2003 - it was recommended by a friend in Australia and loved the location. In February 2006 we came to Italy to live for 12 months and stayed again at the Rosetta for 4 days in February, 4 days during Christmas and prior to our return to Australia in February 2007 for 3 days. I made only one mistake - trying out another place in Rome for 2 days which was a nightmare! Our hosts were wonderful - on arriving at 6.30am Christmas eve, we asked if we could leave our luggage at reception until check in time. The owner was wonderful and as the room was ready she allowed us to go to it immediately to rest after our journey. The owners also allowed our luggage to be left there for more than half a day prior to our departure. The location is central to everything, safe and only a short walk/bus ride from the train station. I cant recommend the hotel highly enough - yes it is basic- but spotless and value for money - who cares about "included breakfast" when the cafe a few doors up on the left as you exit is excellent and cheap..

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: moultonman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rosetta for 4 nights.As others have already said a good location for what in my opinion is a basic no frills hotel.We had room 26 inside overlooking the courtyard which helped with the noise from the street.The room was fairly small with a comfortable bed.It had a air conditioning unit but you must pay 10 euros at reception to get the control box.The bathroom was a good size with a strong shower and clean towels everyday.The cafe just up the road for breakfast was ok but I felt expensive.15 euros for 2 cups of tea and 2 croissants.One other warning there is a cafe called Sqi Sito across the road and about 30 yards down the street on the corner.We went for 2 caffe Lattes and sat outside on our last night and was given a bill for 14 euros.The drinks were only a medium size.I felt this was a complete rip off and told the manager so.Avoid this place.Overall for 80 euros that we paid the Rosetta offers very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: bmazur
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, celebrating our 60th birthdays in Europe, spent 4 nights at the Hotel Rosetta in mid May 2007. We had room 7 which was on the 2nd floor inside corner, just above the most wonderful little restaurant one could want. More on that later. Our room , average in size compared to our previous 10 days in Paris, Florence and Sienna, included washroom and shower was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. We had two windows overlooking the small streets below that gave a intriguing look upon Italian life passing by. Any street noise was shut out when the windows were closed. The price was very low compared to other offerings when we were booking, but worth double. The location was a few minutes walk to all the sights of ancient Rome. The only public transport, buses just outside the main doors, we used was to go to the Vatican/ St Peters, and to the train station on our leaving. It is amazing close to everything and so much more. The staff at this hotel were wonderful. It is family run with some help. Special kudo's to the young daughter, ( we apologize we do not remember her name) and to Gianni. They spoke great English, as compared to our Italian, and were willing and able to provide any information and suggestions to assist our visit to Rome. The restaurant downstairs. At the recommendation of Gianni, we tried this wonderful place the first night we were there. Sufficed to say we were impressed. This was Italy!! We tried a different location the next night, but came back the next two nights. The meals are wonderful, staff are great and they serve a wonderful red wine. Our meals were long, delicious, entertaining and the whole bottle of wine later, it was only a few steps home! We would most definately recommend this hotel to anyone wanting the Rome experience. We will be back for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family hotel in the heart of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Partlan
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful 1st trip to Italy and intend to return again much sooner than later. Spend 3 nights at the Hotel Rosetta, Via Cavour No 295, Roma at the recommendation of a friend. The hotel is family run and the location is terrific. A 5 minute walk from the Colesseum, The Roman Forum, the magnificent Military muesem, close by is the Via Del Corso which has fantastic shopping to suit all tastes and on route there you can view the Spanish steps, Trevi Fountain, The Pantheon, even cross the river to the Vatican. The food is simply the best.....wonderful!, and the waiters are impeciable and so gracious at all times. The restaurants and cafe's are spotless. The Hotel Rosetta is very central, clean, comfortable and very reasonable, ask for a room overlooking the courtyard, it is less noisy but then all cities are noisy. The owners are charming and very friendly and always available be it for information or advise or to order a taxi. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for somewhere nice and safe to stay in a busy city, central to all locations & some fabulous cafe's and restaurants and there is also an Irish bar close by called "The Surge" if you tire of the vino! Hotel Rosetta and Rome are wonderful! See you again soon.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT BASIC FAMILY-RUN HOTEL, WONDERFULLY CONVENIENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: southlondonerSE27
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four - two adults and two children- who haved stayed at the Hotel Rosetta for 3 consecutive years in the October half term. October is a great month to visit the eternal city as it is not too hot but the weather is sunny and pleasantly warm. The Rosetta is an absolute find as it's location is so hard to beat for the price. You are within easy walking distance of major attractions such as the Colosseum and right next door to the Forum. The Hotel is a small family run establishment and they have always been friendly and eager to please- looking after luggage on check-in and checkout days, arranging taxis etc. The rooms are basic but clean and comfortable with a TV and telephone. There is no safe in the room but staff happily take care of your valuables in their safe at the check-in desk. All staff are absolutely fantastic and try their best to help with whatever query you might have. Gianni gets our special recommendation as he is always so kind and patient with the children ( and us!) The room is cleaned and tidied every day to a high standard and fresh towels and toiletries provided. ( Though if you wish for designer soap/shampoo or you have very sensitive skin you had better bring your own). There are no tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms and if you are facing onto the busy Via Cavour it is noisy from the traffic which does not seem to abate even at night and if you have to open the window to get some fresh air it is even louder. Breakfast is not provided, but there is a great little cafe ( turn left from the main door onto the Via Cavour and walk up a little way) that serves delicious cakes and pastries and even coped with our poor grasp of the Italian language to give us hot tea complete with hastily improvised tin foil lids! You are lucky to have two great restaurants within a minutes walk- the Taverna dei Fori Imperiali (Via Madonna dei Monti, 16) which serves gorgeous food, including pasta that I continue to dream about- at very reasonable prices. They are also extremely friendly and accommodating to children. There is another restaurant in the same block as the Hotel ( I'm sorry but I do not recall the name but Gianni will give details-turn right from the main door that opens onto the Via Cavour and then immediately right again and walk to the end of the hotel block and the restaurant is on the corner). This restaurant is always packed with Italians and you might have to queue. The guy in charge seems a bit grumpy but traditional Italian dishes are served swiftly with the minimum of fuss and are very tasty and excellent value with the added bonus that after a hard day pounding the streets of Rome you do not have far to return to the Hotel! As for the sights of Rome they are just too numerous and wonderful to mention, but the location of this great little Hotel means that they are all virtually within easy walking distance without you being charged an exorbitant price for the privilege and convenience and it is a convenience to be near The Colosseum, The Baths of Caracalla, The Pantheon, The Forum, Palatine etc etc.These sites can all be visited from the Hotel without use of any public transport ( though this is too easily available). We loved the Pantheon, The Trevi Fountain, the Turtle Fountain, Giolotti's (which has a complicated system for purchasing the most mouthwatering gelati I have ever tasted-you pay at the till before going to the ice cream counter to choose your flavours and the waiters can be rather rude and do not tolerate any indecision), the sunday market in Trastevere,Parc de Borghese and the art in the Vatican ( do not miss the Caravaggio's in the Church bordering on the Piazza del Popolo) the slices of fresh pizza, authentic Roman fast food, I could go on and on but really Rome is simply stunning, there is so much to see and appreciate that a trip lasting a few days does not give you enough time- Rome really deserves all the superlatives ever written about it- the number of ancient and historical sites at virtually every corner means that it is a stunning city to visit. We look forward to our next trip to Rome and will certainly want to return to The Hotel Rosetta which we cannot praise highly enough.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Rosetta
HotelInfo.Address: Via Cavour, 295 scala B/1, Rome, Italy
